ja52:1.1: The story, which is told in full in the Mahājanakajātaka Ja 539, relates how Janaka of Videha regained his kingdom through unremitting effort. | The Janakas were the famed kingly house of Videha. At MN 83:20.1 a Janaka is framed as the source of the kingdom’s decline. A King Janaka was Sītā’s father in the Rāmāyaṇa, and one discussed philosophy with Yājñavalkya in the Bṛhadāraṇyaka Upaniṣad. It seems impossible to determine which, if any, are the same person.
ja52:1.4: The story of Ja 539 relates how he survived the sinking of his ship.
